First, all dharmas are devoid of self, yet sentient beings do not believe that dharmas are devoid of self, therefore the TathÄgata gives rise to great compassion for those sentient beings;

Twenty-fifth, the sentient beings in this realm abide in the world, each attached to their own views, engaging in disputes, giving rise to greed, anger, and delusion. Good man!

How is it that the Bodhisattva can establish the various adornments of the supreme palace?
Good man!

It is just like the power of the wind, which universally establishes the various adornments of all palaces, causing the grasses and trees to sprout and grow, with roots, stems, branches, leaves, flowers, and fruits flourishing, and also causing the various limbs and parts of all sentient beings to be differentiated.

Bodhisattvas are like this, using boundless wisdom, unattached wisdom, unobstructed wisdom, and eloquence, like the wind arranging all the various perfections of the mundane and supramundane worlds, and are able to understand and demonstrate the bestowal of various distinctions.
Now I will briefly explain:
It is said that these dharmas are able to give rise to the evil destinies and the good destinies, and are the masters of what is born;

Good man!
How can bodhisattvas be able to decisively expound various wonderful dharmas in the assembly, just like the wind blowing on various kalpa trees, constantly raining down pleasing flowers like rain?
Good man!

Just as the wind blows on the kalpa trees, the pleasing flowers rain down like rain, as well as various precious adornments, clothing, food and drink, and other necessities, which are fully provided. The gentle breeze blows and spreads them around, reaching the devas and humans.
When sentient beings obtain them, they are no longer troubled, and their minds are filled with joy;
they experience supreme delight, and their bodies and minds are at ease;
they frolic and play, enjoying the pleasures of the Dharma garden;
at all times their appearance is dignified, their power is swift;

Bodhisattvas are also like this!

Just as that wind invites the Tathagatas and Bodhisattvas in the pure worlds to definitely expound the appropriate wonderful Dharma in the assembly, and causes the flowers of the Dharma treasure to rain down like rain, namely the sutras, geya, vyakarana, gatha, udana, nidana, avadana, itivrttaka, jataka, vaipulya, adbhutadharma, and upadeÅ›a, sometimes rising, sometimes falling, sometimes following, sometimes going against, expounding in various ways.

Moreover, it can manifest the inconceivable illusory phenomena, causing the wisdom of illusion to be directed towards it.
Moreover, it causes sentient beings to various increase in all phenomena, to play with spiritual powers, and to experience joy and pleasure;
But only with questions and answers, they can bring satisfaction;
Free from the middle and extremes, they give rise to vast and skillful spiritual powers.
Because they are always able to love and enjoy the Dharma garden, their bodies are without fatigue;
Their verbal and mental actions never violate;
The majestic virtue of all humans and gods is vast;
They fully enjoy all dharmas, never diminishing;
They always give rise to the bright and shining observation of prajÃ±Ä, heading towards the supreme and special dharmas.

Emitting a great sound, he spoke the dharmas of the aggregates, the unobstructed Dharma wheel;

Moreover, he was able to manifest all forms, understanding and attaining the pure basis, abiding at all times until the end of the future.

This is called the bodhisattva's pure Dharma wheel, samÄdhi, liberation, and dhÄraá¹‡Ä« accumulated over incalculable eons, which, in the assembly surrounded by that great ocean, Mount Sumeru, CakravÄla mountains, and so forth, in the midst of those beings who are to be tamed and matured, give rise to the wind wheel of wisdom and extinguish all remaining bases.

Bodhisattvas who accomplish these ten qualities are equal to the wind.
At that time, Bodhisattva Cease Coverings addressed the Buddha, saying:
World-Honored One!
Expounding these ten kinds of Dharma gates, replete with various [qualities], is extremely rare!
All sentient beings are all satisfied.

If there are gods and humans who can give rise to pure faith, understanding, and practice in this Dharma, as taught by the Buddha, they will attain completeness in this life and the next, and be able to obtain the bliss of Åšakra and BrahmÄ, which is exclusively beneficial to others.

If one slanders them, they are called foolish people who will fall into evil realms and experience various sufferings, and will also be despised by all worlds, including gods, humans, and asuras.
Furthermore, good man!
Because bodhisattvas accomplish ten kinds of dharmas, they are equal to space.

Because bodhisattvas accomplish these ten dharmas, they are equal to empty space.
Furthermore, good man!
Bodhisattvas who accomplish ten kinds of dharmas are equal to empty space.
What are the ten?
First, they are neither greedy nor hateful towards attractive or unattractive forms;
Second, they are neither greedy nor hateful towards pleasant or unpleasant sounds;
Third, they are neither greedy nor hateful towards fragrant or foul smells;
Fourth, they are neither greedy nor hateful towards delicious or foul tastes;

Furthermore, good sons!
Bodhisattvas who accomplish ten kinds of dharmas are equal to the moon.

First, being able to bring joy and happiness to all sentient beings;

How do bodhisattvas cause all sentient beings to obtain physical bliss?
Good sons!
Just as the moon appears, able to bring coolness, with a lovable nature, causing sentient beings to obtain physical bliss.
Bodhisattvas are also like this!
Appearing in the world, able to remove all the heat and distress of sentient beings, with a lovable nature, causing all sentient beings to obtain physical bliss.
How do bodhisattvas obtain the joy of being seen?
Good sons!
Just as the moon appears, its light and color fresh and pure, causing sentient beings to joyfully delight in seeing it.
Bodhisattvas appearing are also like this, their faculties tranquil, their deportment and virtues pure and complete, causing all sentient beings to joyfully delight in seeing them.
How can bodhisattvas increase pure dharmas?
Good man!
It is like the bright moon, which increases day by day until it is full, and then it is endowed with various lights and colors.
Bodhisattvas are also like this.
From the initial arousal of the mind to sitting on the seat of enlightenment, the pure dharmas gradually increase and grow until they are fully endowed with omniscience.

Good man!
It is like the dark fortnight, when the light and colors of the moon decrease day by day until on the fifteenth day, all its light and color cannot be seen.

Good man!

In the same way, when a bodhisattva appears in the world, he realizes the nature of dharmas and is born from the Dharma, not relying on the impure birth from parents, kalala, and so forth, and therefore his body is pure with a radiant complexion and brilliance.

Good man!
Just as the moon god rides in the supreme vehicle, illuminating the four continents.
Bodhisattvas are like this, riding the supreme vehicle, with the radiance of wisdom immeasurable and boundless throughout all worlds.
How do bodhisattvas always attain adornment?
Good man!
Like the moon god, whose majestic virtue and adornments are always fresh and not withered.
Bodhisattvas are like this, always adorning themselves with the Dharma of merit.
How do bodhisattvas attain the joy of the Dharma?
Good man!
Like the moon god, who at all times delights in the pleasures of desire.
Bodhisattvas are like the moon, at all times delighting in the pleasures of the Dharma garden, not delighting in the pleasures of desire.
How do bodhisattvas attain great spiritual power and great majestic virtue?
Good man!
Like the moon god, who has great spiritual powers and great majestic virtue.
Bodhisattvas are also like this!
They have great spiritual powers and great majestic virtue, namely the great nature of blessings and the great nature of wisdom.
Good man!
Bodhisattvas accomplish these ten dharmas, and are equal to the moon.
Moreover, good sons!
Bodhisattvas who accomplish ten kinds of dharmas are equal to the sun.
What are the ten?
First, they are able to destroy all the darkness of ignorance;
Second, they are able to subdue sentient beings and cause them to awaken;
Third, they are able to illuminate the ten directions;
Fourth, they are able to manifest wholesome dharmas;
Fifth, they have extinguished all defilements;
Sixth, they are able to create light;
Seventh, they are able to outshine all the heretical teachings of non-Buddhists;
Eighth, they are able to show high and low;
Ninth, they give rise to the activities of what is to be done, namely all pure wholesome dharmas;
Tenth, they attain the love and delight of good people.
How are bodhisattvas able to destroy all the darkness of ignorance?
Good sons!
It is just as when the sun appears, it destroys all darkness.
The rising of the Bodhisattva-sun is also like this, able to destroy all the darkness of ignorance.
How does the Bodhisattva tame sentient beings and cause them to awaken?
Good man!
Just as when the sun appears, it causes all lotus flowers to bloom.
When the Bodhisattva-sun appears, it tames sentient beings and causes them to awaken.

Just as when the sun appears, it creates various lights for all sentient beings in JambudvÄ«pa.
When the bodhisattva appears, he emits the light of wisdom for all sentient beings, able to destroy the darkness of ignorance and all hindrances.

Just as when the sun appears, it can completely outshine [the stars], the sun does not think:
'I can outshine all ignorance!'
Yet the nature of the Dharma is like this.
When the sun of the bodhisattva appears, it can manifest its majestic light, outshining the heretical theories of non-Buddhists, the bodhisattva does not think like this:
'I can outshine the heretical theories!'
Yet the nature of the Dharma is like this.

Just as when the sun appears in JambudvÄ«pa, it can illuminate all high and low beings,
when the sun of the bodhisattvas appears, with the light of wisdom they see all beings, whether equal or unequal.
That is to say, entering the holy paths is called equal;
being in the non-paths is called unequal.
How does the bodhisattva give rise to the activities he should do?
Good man!
Just as when the sun appears, it causes all farmers to engage in their work,
when the sun of the bodhisattvas appears, it gives rise to all the activities of wholesome dharmas.
How does the bodhisattva attain the love and joy of good people?

Just as when the sun appears, it is loved and enjoyed by all good people, and is universally hated and resented by evil people,

when the sun of the bodhisattvas appears, it is loved and enjoyed by all wise and good people, and is universally hated and resented by foolish people, ignorant evil people, those who follow deviant paths, those who turn their backs on nirvÄá¹‡a, and those who delight in saá¹ƒsÄra.

It is like a lion who, wherever it goes, is always fearless, seeing itself as having no equal.
Bodhisattvas are like this. Wherever they go, they are unafraid, seeing themselves as unequaled.
How do bodhisattvas attain fearlessness?
Good man!
It is just like a lion, who upon hearing the sounds of wild foxes and other beasts is never afraid.
Bodhisattvas are like this. When they encounter all kinds of disputes and arguments, they are never afraid, neither sinking into themselves nor becoming arrogant.
How do bodhisattvas not retreat from the path?
Good man!
It is like a lion, who when called to come forward never retreats from the path.
Bodhisattvas are like this. When they are called to come to all places of dispute and argument, their minds are never discouraged.
How do bodhisattvas roar like lions?
Good man!
It is like when a lion roars, the evil beasts and wild foxes each flee in all directions in terror.
Bodhisattvas are like this, proclaiming the unsurpassed vehicle with the lion's roar, able to cause all non-Buddhists, wild foxes, and evil beasts that grasp at I and mine to flee in all directions.

Although bodhisattvas make this lion's roar, they never disturb any sentient beings, but only wish to subdue those sentient beings who grasp at I and mine, causing them to forever abandon [such views].
How do bodhisattvas attain fearlessness?
Good man!
It is like a lion surveying all places with fearlessness.
Bodhisattvas are like this, able to observe the realms of all sentient beings with pure deportment, attaining fearlessness.
How do bodhisattvas roam through gardens and forests?
It is like a lion whose nature is fearless, able to display its power and roam through gardens and forests.
Bodhisattvas are like this, their nature always tranquil, always able to play in the unobstructed Dharma forest.
What is meant by 'the bodhisattva relies on mountain caves'?
Good man!
It is like a lion relying on a mountain cave.
The bodhisattva is like this, always able to peacefully abide in the wisdom mountain cave.
What is meant by 'the bodhisattva attains non-attachment'?
Good man!
It is like a lion abandoning its cache, attaining non-attachment.
The bodhisattva is like this, abandoning all the heavy burdens of afflictions, forever without attachment.
What is meant by 'the bodhisattva is like that lion, naturally courageous and powerful, alone without a second, able to break the armies of others'?
Good man!
The bodhisattva sits at the site of enlightenment, alone without a second, able to crush the armies of all mÄras.
What is meant by 'the bodhisattva protects all the seedlings of wholesome dharmas'?
Good man!
It is like a lion wherever it goes near a village, all the evil beasts are unable to harm the seedlings nearby.
Bodhisattvas are like this. Wherever they stay or travel, no non-Buddhist or evil beasts can harm the sprouts of good dharmas.
Good sons!
Bodhisattvas who accomplish these ten dharmas attain being like a lion.
Furthermore, good sons!
Bodhisattvas who accomplish ten kinds of dharmas are able to tame well.
What are the ten?
First, the bodhi mind is firm;
Second, what is done is able to purify the bodhi mind;
Third, the faculties are well guarded;
Fourth, one is able to head towards the right path;
Fifth, one is able to bear heavy burdens;
Sixth, one never becomes weary;
Seventh, one attains right livelihood and benefits sentient beings;
Eighth, one abandons all deceitful speech;
Ninth, one is forever free from flattery and deception;
Tenth, one's nature is straightforward.
Good sons!
Bodhisattvas who accomplish these ten dharmas are able to skillfully subdue.
Furthermore, good sons!
Bodhisattvas who accomplish ten kinds of dharmas attain the intrinsic nature of quiescence.
What are the ten?
First, attaining the yoga master;
Second, cultivating the nature of emptiness extensively;
Third, revealing the holy path, free from all entanglements and unobstructed;
Fourth, in accord with the TathÄgata's teachings, practicing without contradiction;
Fifth, in accord with the principle of the equality of all dharmas, penetrating the true characteristics, wandering in the world, the mind always humble like the son of an outcaste;
Sixth, at all times always able to give rise to the thought of begging, far removed from arrogance, intoxication, and heedlessness;
Seventh, having no doubts in the Buddha's teachings, able to directly realize the Buddha's right wisdom;
Eighth, having no hesitation regarding any dharma, because one knows the nature of dharmas through one's own inner realization;
Ninth, not relying on others' enlightenment, they see the path themselves;
Tenth, becoming a field of merit for the world, they head towards enlightenment.
Good man!
Bodhisattvas who accomplish these ten qualities attain the nature of quiescence.
Furthermore, good man!
Bodhisattvas who accomplish ten qualities attain the state of being like a lotus.
What are the ten?
First, being unstained;
Second, not being stained by even a little bit of wrongdoing;
Third, attaining the fragrance of the precepts;
Fourth, always being pure;
Fifth, having a smiling face;
Sixth, being free from coarseness;
Seventh, being able to manifest auspiciousness;
Eighth, arousing awareness;
Ninth, maturing awareness;
Tenth, being taken up by others.
How are bodhisattvas unstained?
Good man!
It is like a lotus flower that emerges from the water without being stained.
Why is it so?
Because the nature of that lotus flower is pure.
In the same way, although bodhisattvas emerge from the water of birth and death, once they emerge, they are not stained.
Why is it so?

How are bodhisattvas not tainted by even the slightest sin or defilement?
Good man!
It is like a lotus flower that is not tainted by even the slightest bit of water.
Bodhisattvas are like this, not tainted by even the slightest sin or defilement.
How do bodhisattvas attain the wonderful fragrance of precepts?
Good man!
Wherever there is a place where lotus flowers can grow, their fragrance pervades that place.
Bodhisattvas are like this, traveling through all human regions, and the fragrance of their precepts pervades everywhere they go.
How is it that bodhisattvas always attain purity?
Good man!
Just as wherever lotus flowers grow, that place becomes a pure place for all the worldly villages, brahmins, kshatriyas, and others,

bodhisattvas are like this. Wherever they are born, it is a place of tranquil purity, and they are always protected and remembered by the buddhas, praised by the bodhisattvas, and approached by devas, nagas, yakshas, gandharvas, asuras, kinnaras, mahoragas, humans, and non-humans.
How is it that bodhisattvas smile with their mouths?
Good man!
It is just like a lotus flower that blooms all around, and all beings who see it are delighted in their hearts.
Bodhisattvas are like this, always having a peaceful and smiling face, free from frowns, and with pure faculties.
How do bodhisattvas attain non-harshness?
Good man!
It is like a lotus flower, whose nature is soft and not harsh.
Bodhisattvas are like this, their nature is always soft, their speech is not harsh, and they are also free from deceit.

How do bodhisattvas awaken and enlighten?
Good man!
It is like a lotus flower, when it is in full bloom, it is called awakened and enlightened.
